intro: Sphaeralcea albiflora, commonly known as white-flowered globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often spiny. Sphaeralcea albiflora thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert and foothill habitats.
